description:
This is among my proudest creations after working on it for more than a year. If you like pina coladas,  you are in for a treat. Full notes for this are in the /r/DIY_eJuice's June 2016 Monthly Recipe Thread. 

New cover art by @mlNikon!
author: ID10-T

reviews.text: WS at 2%? That's how you do it and proof that WS-23 makes everything better as I just my a new 30ml today after running out for a week so I didn't mix a damn thing. On topic though, this is good but I wonder if it can be deconstructed a bit. I'm thinking dropping TPA's Pineapple and subbing TPA Reg Coconut for FLV's Sweet Coconut along with a low % of toasted marshmallow and possibly FLV cream instead of Cream Fresh.

No fan of pina coladas but l did mix it up, l still was no fan and it was meh. I added 2% WS23 30% to it and it was superb! Apart from the brain freezes l could just taste a hint of mango! Will mix again with ws23 @2%. Good work Dave! 10/10
Really smooth and authentic tasting Pina Colada recipe. Like a real Pina Colada, the flavors are really easy to isolate and identify, but all blend together seamlessly. Perfect.
Just excellent! The work it must have taken to perfect this is impressive. Thank you!

Worth every penny. The Coconuts and Pineapples come together to round out a perfect Coconut and Pineapple flavor. Jamaica Special is delicious and Cream Fresh ties everything together. Really great job!

best pina colada recipe ever! nice creaminess and absolutely no suntan lotion. however, i did sun FLV sweet coconut at the same percent since i didnt have TFA coconut (original). sure its bangin either way. great as a shake and vape, creaminess really comes out after 3 days.

Delicious and feel the sand between your toes accurate. Like kicking back on a white sand beach, feels like I should have a cocktail umbrella attached to my mod when this is in the tank. Pina Colada with no doubts.

Made some small modifications as I did not have all these flavors.  This is very good, I've been chasing after a Pina colada mix since I started mixing.  This is what I've been looking for. It's worthy of a large batch.
It's fantastic, mixed mine with no rum for personal reasons üòÖ

If you like Pina Colada you must mix this recipe! I ordered the flavors I was missing to mix this and glad I did! Spot on Pina colada. Nice smooth flavorful recipe. 5 stars all day long.. another awesome mix Dave!
Very nice vape, well thought out recipe. For me, I turned down the pineapple a hair and increased the rum, for my personal taste.
Easy five star. The amount of work that went into this must have been a lot to achieve the balance presented. Fantastic full flavored in your face pina colada.

I bought the one shot of this from ECX and am very pleased.  Very balanced recipe.  It hits my palate very well.  I am sensitive to coconut flavors getting peppery and this is smooth in there.  The pineapple is forward and the other notes blend in well behind it.  I have not drank in a long time so I was a little worried the alcohol note would be too forward, but it blends in fantastic and completes this recipe.  Spot on.

Two words. Fucking amazing. I don't know why it took me so long to finally mix this up, but I don't think I'll stop anytime soon. This is a perfect pina colada. Just the right balance of coconut cream and pineapple juice. The work you put in on this definitely shows. It's very full flavored and nails the profile spot on.
Great recipe that overcomes my general dislike of TPA Pineapple.

Drinking leads me to crack cocaine, burning cars, dumpsters behind strip clubs, homeless Vietnam vets, and long stints in prison. St. Louis better get ready for a whirlwind of absolute mayhem because I'm pounding back some Pi√±a Coladas again. Well, I could have sworn I was. This stuff is as accurate as you can get in a vape. This is the real deal. The pineapple juice is perfection. The coconut is sweet and present, but where's the lotion?? Where is it?? It isn't here! Oh, right, it isn't supposed to be. I thought that was impossible, but leave it to ID to prove me wrong. The Rum comes through right where I liked it in the real stuff.. A good pour, but not enough to kick you in the teeth. That's what Old Crow and other miserably cheap whiskey is for, or so I was lead to believe. This has a smooth and creamy mouthfeel like it was blended by a professional alcoholic. This is great for the spring and summer. It's refreshing and bright. Mix it up. Why wouldn't you? This page of reviews might as well be the night sky. Cheers!
Wow, been vaping this for just more than a month. Perfection. You can be proud with reason. Thank you for sharing.

After a 3 day steep, I must say that this is incredibly spot on. The combination of TFA Coconut Candy, FA Coco and TFA Coconut hit your palate on the inhale and is without a doubt the right choice for this profile, giving the coconut the creamy smoothness without pushing it too close to the lotion boundary. The pineapple concentrates and the FA Jamaican Special do something wonderful with the exhale, imparting a boozy pineapple, that has both the sweetness and a slight bite you'd expect from a ripened pineapple, with slight rum undertones. The rum undertones do tend to linger on the tongue, but aren't unpleasant by any means.

Definitely amazing, great job on the recipe. The flavor profile is spot on. Some people seem to think the rum is a little too much, I found it to be the perfect amount, it adds quite a bit to its authenticity IMO.
On point Pina Colada! Perfectly balanced, worth the investment for the flavorings. ADV material here folks.

Mixed on 11/20 and vaped on 12/5 and it is perfection, though I love your Mango Colada even more. Your coconut-fu is just as on-point here, too! How you manage to coax every bit of sweetness and creaminess out of that blend of coconuts without a whiff of sunscreen is pure magic, to say nothing of the perfect balance of pineapple. Love it! Thanks for another flawless recipe.

This is a true Pinacolada cocktail, I mean it's even better than most so cold pinacolada in pubs. This is how a real one should taste and it's delicious. Not too creamy but enough to let the coconuts throw their party !
Perfectly balanced and tasty as all hell.  Mix this.  It's that good.
Genuinely cannot believe how much this tastes like Pina Colada.  Really like it, though the Rum is a little in your face for me so will tweak it down a little next batch.  Great recipe
It's everything I was told.
I like this recipe because it tastes like pi√±a colada to me and I like pi√±a coladas. Am I doing this right?
